metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10145 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Off-by-one error in coders/wpg.c in ImageMagick allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors related to a string copy.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10145` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.5
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.5
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.5
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.5
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.5
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.5
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.5').
